column4: I installed a program called Nessus, how do i find it to open it?
if i type the sudo apt-get command it says the latest version is installed
with the .deb file i downloaded from their website
Any reason to not use the version in the repositories?
The Ubuntu Software Repositories.. hold on.
when i do that after i had installed it it says the latest version is installed
Look at the nessusd and nessus-adduser manpages to get started.
or do you mean from their website?
I suggest you remove the version that you installed from the .deb and use the version in the repos.
how would i remove it i cant find it in the Add/Remove area
thanks, i then used the apt-get cmd and it installed and i can open it :D
